intro: Phyteuma leianthum, commonly known as the Narrow-leaved Phyteuma, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of yellow to orange, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Phyteuma leianthum prefers well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and borders.
